meanings.definition: A place where birds are raised for commercial purposes.
meanings.sent1: The birdfarm had many different types of birds for sale.
meanings.sent2: We visited the birdfarm to buy some fresh eggs.
meanings.sent3: The birdfarm owner joked that the chickens were the real bosses.
meanings.sent4: The birdfarm was a bustling marketplace of feathers and chirps.
meanings.sent5: The birdfarm was a colorful paradise of fluttering wings.

meanings.definition: To operate a farm where birds are raised.
meanings.sent1: She decided to birdfarm after retiring from her office job.
meanings.sent2: They birdfarm together as a family business.
meanings.sent3: He birdfarms with such passion that even the roosters applaud.
meanings.sent4: Birdfarming requires patience and dedication to feathered friends.
meanings.sent5: In his dreams, he birdfarms under a sky full of flying birds.

meanings.definition: The act of raising birds on a farm.
meanings.sent1: Her favorite part of the day was the birdfarm chores.
meanings.sent2: Birdfarm involves feeding, cleaning, and caring for the birds.
meanings.sent3: The birdfarm life was a daily symphony of squawks and tweets.
meanings.sent4: She found peace in the routine of birdfarm tasks.
meanings.sent5: The birdfarm was her sanctuary, a place of feathered friends.
